Articles.Content: New pics with Jool and the ocean moon from Nova! http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/12406-Show-off-your-awesome-KSP-Pictures/page106?highlight=show

if the list of things in .17 on the first post under here are being kept up to date, seems like there is alot of stuff, still in planning and in production. So it seems to me .17 is still at least a month away.

Most of those things are minor issues. Mechanics are mostly in. Scenarios, and pre-builds can be done in 2-3 days. And Last time we heard from C7, the internal cockpits were being developed. I think new parts will just be cut from this release, along with some planets, and moved to .18

So the only thing would be the visual representation of drag, and You can wrap up .17 I think that the test group is or will be shortly very busy...
The list has not been updated in quite a while. Last edited by HarvesteR; 27th August 2012 at 20:29. Most of the team has also been quiet lately too, except Nova.

I'm actually ok with cutting some of the planets from this release. After all, it almost seems too much stuff / too good to be true, for one release. I think that they should leave some planets / moons for release with .18 or .19 since they are a big part of this game when it comes to creating more gameplay. What could possibly be more exciting than the addition of planetary objects? Adding all these bodies in one release will surely make other releases feel not as awesome.
Nova released new pictures with jool and the ocean moon! http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/12406-Show-off-your-awesome-KSP-Pictures/page106?highlight=show
Sillisko posted these in the awesome ksp pictures thread:

Atmosphere looks great!

Edited September 10, 2012 by TheRequimen
Guy above me beat me to it.

Are there any news of harvester? He hasn't updated the "KSP 0.17" Thread for quite a time now. He propably hasn't got the time though.

Looking foward for meeting you all on or around jool!

I'm actually ok with cutting some of the planets from this release.

This, my good sir, is madness!

This, my good sir, is madness!

Nope. He has a point. Even adding 1 planet with moons would be enough exploring for one release. Think how long did we play with Kerbin+its moons. Moving planets to other releases would give us all time to properly explore what we get. If You get 5 planets, You'll just go to each body once, and that will be it, because You still need to get to the others ASAP
Maybe its just me, but Laythe looks remarkably large. I'd say Laythe is bigger than the Mun (diameter 400 km) ...

I found that someone made a wallpaper of novas pic,

why make a wallpaper when you can just do this:

took me like 2 seconds and now sits on my desktop

And on my desktop

Maybe its just me, but Laythe looks remarkably large. I'd say Laythe is bigger than the Mun (diameter 400 km) ...

I think it is bigger than mun because usually gas giant's moons are bigger than rocky planets moons
Does Laythe have atmosphere? I think so, but I'm not entirely sure. Water is in liquid state there, right?

Does Laythe have atmosphere? I think so, but I'm not entirely sure. Water is in liquid state there, right?

It indeed is liquid and it has continents too

it has continents too

This part I don't like. I hoped it'd force us to design vehicles capable of landing on water:(

Edited September 10, 2012 by ForumHelper

This part I don't like. I hoped it'll force us to design vehicles capable of landing on water:(

If this is Laythe I think it looks way better than in the old pic. It didnt look like it had land in the other picture and it looked a bit too clean and polished, like a giant blue marble out of place.

This part I don't like. I hoped it'd force us to design vehicles capable of landing on water:(

I'd really like it to have some landmass. What Nova posted may be a bit much, though.

Still pretty pumped!

If this is Laythe I think it looks way better than in the old pic. It didnt look like it had land in the other picture

I guess they didn't call it OceanMoon for nothing.

and it looked a bit too clean and polished, like a giant blue marble out of place.

The game being in alpha, I personally wouldn't have minded.

Edited September 10, 2012 by Accelerando

We already got pictures of Duna and his moon Ike, Jool with Laythe and Bop and I think Vall and Tylo were somewhere at the pictures too. So there are still Eve, Gilly and Moho left. Awesome work, Nova. Keep creating the system Kerbol.

We already got pictures of Duna and his moon Ike, Jool with Laythe and Bop and I think Vall and Tylo were somewhere at the pictures too. So there are still Eve, Gilly and Moho left. Awesome work, Nova. Keep creating the system Kerbol.

I bet ya Nova won't show moho, we will have to find it ourselves. If Nova said it's finished but not post a pic then he won't show it. He probably hasn't made a rocket yet to get there
What kind of planet is Moho? I'm losing track of all these planets, which can only be a good thing.

I love the fact that Laythe has both land and water, if you wanted to build a rocket to land on water then build a rocket and land it on the water part, at least you aren't restricted to just water. I for one would like to land on a coast so I get the best of both; maybe someone will build an amphibious rover, unless there already is one? (hint hint modders)

Well, you could try landing this thing on the ocean. Then you can potentially have a mobile derrick.

the mod, itself
They should give Kerbalnauts small inflatable dinghys, like the things the Apollo astronauts had when they splashed down. Would certainly help for ocean exploration.

I've nearly finished my amphibious rover for Laythe

I think it might be a tad too heavy to work on Eve tho.. unfortunately..
